intro: Daucus gouanii, commonly known as the Guanacaste fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive, sometimes spicy scent when crushed. Daucus gouanii is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
